original_title: CA quashes summons on Senior Cop Deshabandu
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Court of Appeal issued a writ order on Monday (26) invalidating the summons issued to Snr. DIG Deshabandu Thennakoon to appear at the Fort MC as a suspect with regard to the discovery of cash from the President's House in 2022 when protestors stormed the premises.
Rs. 17.8 Million in cash that was found inside the President's House on the 9th of July, and was later handed over to the Sri Lanka Police. A cour case was filed over the matter, thereafter.

In addition, the Court of Appeal issued a writ order invalidating the letter issued by the Attorney General seeking to name Senior DIG Deshabandu Thennakoon as a suspect with regard to the attack on 'GotaGoGama' in 2022.
F1 team Alpine secure €200m backing from investors including Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds
